com.dhj.robotics

Class RobotWheelMovement

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dhj.robotics.RobotWheelMovement

  • public class RobotWheelMovement
extends java.lang.Object
    Assuming 1 motor per wheel/track, this object controls the motors together. (Forward calls both wheels/tracks to move forward)
    Author:
    gsmitley

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RobotWheelMovement(Motor leftMotor, Motor rightMotor) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void forward()
      Moves both wheels/tracks forward until stopped
      void forward(long timeInMilliseconds)
      Moves both wheels/tracks forward for given length of time
      Motor getLeftMotor() 
      Motor getRightMotor() 
      void leftTurn(long timeInMilliseconds)
      Spins the left motor in reverse and the right motor forward to turn left for a given length of time
      void reverse()
      Moves both wheels/tracks in reverse until stopped
      void reverse(long timeInMilliseconds)
      Moves both wheels/tracks in reverse for given length of time
      void rightTurn(long timeInMilliseconds)
      Spins the left motor forward and the right motor in reverse to turn right for a given length of time
      void setLeftMotor(Motor leftMotor) 
      void setRightMotor(Motor rightMotor) 
      void stop()
      Turns both motors off by setting each relay to the off position, sending the same polarity to each motor terminal

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public void leftTurn(long timeInMilliseconds)

      • rightTurn

        public void rightTurn(long timeInMilliseconds)
        Spins the left motor forward and the right motor in reverse to turn right for a given length of time
        Parameters:
        timeInMilliseconds - Time in milliseconds (1000 milliseconds = 1 second)

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Turns both motors off by setting each relay to the off position, sending the same polarity to each motor terminal
